articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/DailyMail
articles.title: Meghan Markle's brother: Heal rift with father before it's too late
articles.description: Thomas Markle Jr., of Grants Pass, Oregon, tells DailyMail.com his sister needs to reach out to her father, 74, or regret losing the chance to reconcile - and that Kate Middleton's family was better treated.

articles.author: mcassella@politico.com (Megan Cassella)
articles.title: A roadmap for this week's NAFTA talks
articles.description: Chamber lays down its NAFTA gauntlet — Little tariff love at USTR’s China hearings

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: South Africa's rand climbs as dollar hit by Trump Fed comments
articles.description: South Africa's rand firmed more than one percent in early trade on Tuesday, matching gains by its emerging market peers as criticism of Federal Reserve rate hikes by U.S. President Donald Trump hurt the dollar and revived demand for some risk assets.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: South African poultry group seeks to suspend U.S. import quota
articles.description: The South African Poultry Association (SAPA) has filed a legal action to force the government to suspend a quota that excluded imports of U.S. poultry from South Africa's anti-dumping tariff, a senior official with the association said on Tuesday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Russia to start delivering S-400 defence system to Turkey in 2019 - Ifax
articles.description: Russia will begin delivering its advanced S-400 missile defence system to Turkey in 2019, the Interfax news agency cited Russia's state arms exporter Rosoboronexport as saying on Tuesday.

articles.author: Liam Deacon
articles.title: Remainer Phillip Hammond Forced to Rewrite 'Project Fear' Predictions
articles.description: The anti-Brexit Chancellor has been forced to wind back "project fear" predictions for a clean "no deal" Brexit, amid concerns they will be seen as too "negative."

articles.author: Oliver JJ Lane
articles.title: 'Very, Very Damaging': Second Referendum Could Lead to Civil Disobedience, Warns Top Labour MP
articles.description: Labour frontbencher Barry Gardiner warned against holding a second referendum on the question of Brexit Tuesday morning, arguing the importance of supporting democratic norms and legitimacy.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Bahrain says stops issuing visas for Qatari nationals
articles.description: Bahrain's interior ministry said on Tuesday that it would stop issuing new visas to Qatari nationals, escalating measures against Qatar more than a year into a diplomatic row.

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Pakistan's new PM proposes dialogue with India
articles.description: Pakistan's newly-elected prime minister on Tuesday offered to start a dialogue with India to resolve long-running disputes between the two nuclear-armed rivals, including over the Kashmir region.

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Vietnam puts 12 people on trial for alleged subversion
articles.description: A court in Vietnam's Ho Chi Minh City on Tuesday began the trial of 12 people, including two American citizens, on subversion charges as government authorities step up a crackdown on dissent.

articles.author: Simon Kent
articles.title: Report: Corbyn Secretly Visited Israel to Meet Hamas Terrorists
articles.description: UK Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn made a secret trip to Israel to meet Hamas terrorist representatives but not Jewish Israelis, according to a report. | Breitbart Jerusalem

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Singapore's architectural history under threat from redevelopment frenzy
articles.description: A rush to tear down and redevelop buildings in Singapore has prompted calls to conserve ageing properties that symbolise the country's recent history and economic rise.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: S.Korea says expects to sign revised trade deal with U.S. in Sept
articles.description: South Korea's trade minister Kim Hyun-chong told parliament on Tuesday his ministry expected to sign a revised bilateral trade agreement with the United States in September.

articles.author: Melanie Burton
articles.title: Rising costs, trade worries tarnish BHP profit jump, record dividend
articles.description: Concerns over rising costs and the impact of trade tensions between the United States and China weighed on shares of leading miner BHP on Tuesday after a 33 percent jump in annual underlying profit still missed forecasts.

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.title: Exclusive - Trump doesn't expect much from China trade talks this week
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump does not expect much progress from trade talks with China this week in Washington, he told Reuters on Monday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: UK trade minister - EU risks hurting image with Brexit handling: Sky News
articles.description: British trade minister Liam Fox said on Tuesday that the European Union risks damaging its standing in the world if it pursues a Brexit that puts its own "ideological purity" ahead of needs of its citizens.

articles.author: Shreyashi   Sanyal
articles.title: CORRECTED-US STOCKS-Futures gain ahead of planned U.S.-China trade talks
articles.description: U.S. stock index futures rose on Tuesday on hopes that planned trade talks between the United States and China would help resolve the dispute between the world's two largest economies.

articles.author: Shreyashi   Sanyal
articles.title: US STOCKS-Wall St rises on trade hopes, S&P equals longest bull run
articles.description: The benchmark S&P 500 edged closer to a record high on Tuesday, matching its longest-ever bull-market run, as U.S. stocks rose after some encouraging earnings reports and on hopes that the United States and China could resolve their tariff dispute.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Turkish lira slightly firmer after Trump vows 'no concessions'
articles.description: The Turkish lira firmed slightly against the dollar in thin trade on Tuesday, shrugging off comments by U.S. President Donald Trump ruling out agreeing to any demands from Turkey to gain the release of a detained American pastor.

articles.author: Stephanie Kelly
articles.title: UPDATE 10-Oil hits one-week high as Iran-driven rally gathers pace
articles.description: Oil rose to its highest level in a week on Tuesday, buoyed by the prospect of U.S. sanctions on Iran, though the trade dispute between Washington and Beijing kept traders and analysts cautious.
